author: Callum Self
description:
Light versus dark. Jedi versus Sith. Kong versus Kremling. Hero versus villain. The age old battles of two forces are prevalent in all of entertainment, but few feel as impactful as black versus white - and 2010's Pokémon Black and White videogames were a prime example. 25 years later, the Pokémon TCG is finally getting in on the dual release trend, but TCG fans haven't waited for Black Bolt and White Flare's release to decide that ancient question: which is better?

Continue reading Pokémon TCG's Black Bolt and White Flare settle a decade-old videogame debate
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best Pokémon cards, Rare Pokémon cards,
title: Pokémon TCG's Black Bolt and White Flare settle a decade-old videogame debate

author: Mollie Russell
description:
Diamond Comic Distributors, a recently bankrupted company that distributed RPG books for companies like Paizo, Wizards of the Coast, and other third-party D&D and Pathfinder publishers, has asked the bankruptcy court to allow it to liquidate its remaining consignment inventory. Essentially, this would mean that Diamond Comic Distributors can sell the comics, books, and RPG products still in its warehouses in order to pay off its creditors – all without giving a penny to the original publishers.

Continue reading A bankrupt distributor may cost DnD and RPG publishers "tens of thousands"
MORE FROM WARGAMER: DnD 2024 Player's Handbook review, DnD classes guide, DnD races guide
title: A bankrupt distributor may cost DnD and RPG publishers "tens of thousands"

author: Timothy Linward
description:
The revised edition of Star Wars Legion is almost fully armed and operational, as printed versions of the updated Unit Cards, Command Cards, and Upgrade Cards for all the game’s existing models are now available for pre-order via the Asmodee webstore. We’re inching closer to the point when Legion has fully and finally made the leap to hyperspace - or at least, finished its upgrade to a revised set of rules.

Continue reading At last, Star Wars Legion's new rules are up for pre-order!
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best Star Wars board games, Star Wars Legion - release dates roadmap, Star Wars Shatterpoint review
title: At last, Star Wars Legion's new rules are up for pre-order!

author: Matt Bassil
description:
How many MTG sets are there? Wizards of the Coast has released 217 separate card collections over the game’s 32-year history, with four more coming soon: an average of seven new sets per year. To help you keep track, we compiled this complete list of all Magic: The Gathering sets ever made, going right back to the beginning in 1993 - as well as the new MTG sets about to join the party.

Continue reading All MTG sets in order, as of July 2025
MORE FROM WARGAMER: All MTG sets in order, Upcoming MTG release dates, How
title: All MTG sets in order, as of July 2025

author: Timothy Linward
description:
Game designers of the world, if you want to get me very excited about your wargame before I've even played it,  you've got three sure-fire options: include rules for destructible terrain; make ‘falling off buildings’ a regular part of the game; or capture the vibes of a specific piece of fiction that I love really, really well. Games Workshop’s latest rules reveal articles for Warhammer: The Horus Heresy third edition have nailed the third of these so well that my lingering skepticism about the new game has been suspended - I'm genuinely hyped.

Continue reading Just one new rule has 100% sold me on Warhammer: The Horus Heresy 3rd edition
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Horus Heresy book order, Warhammer 40k factions,
title: Just one new rule has 100% sold me on Warhammer: The Horus Heresy 3rd edition

author: Matt Bassil
description:
The Doctor Who MTG card RMS Titanic has soared to surprising heights, with a 730% price spike in the past week. This card was worth only 60 cents on June 20, but now copies are selling for $5, while surge foils have surged all the way up to $47 - a ridiculous jump considering they were previously worth about $9.

Continue reading MTG rules change triggers 700% price spike for Doctor Who card
MORE FROM WARGAMER: All MTG sets in order, Upcoming MTG release dates, How to play MTG
title: MTG rules change triggers 700% price spike for Doctor Who card

author: Mollie Russell
description:
Redwood, a stunning board game that’s all about taking aesthetically pleasing nature photos, has a delightful discount on Amazon US right now. The $40 tabletop title from Sit Down Games is currently 33% off with an on-sale price of $26.80. If thoughtful games of careful placement and a soothing nature theme are your idea of a great night in, then now might be the right time to invest in Redwood.

Continue reading This gorgeous photography board game is 33% off right now at Amazon
MORE FROM WARGAMER: Best board games, Best family board games, Best board games for adults
title: This gorgeous photography board game is 33% off right now at Amazon
